item.title: Stellantis股价暴跌14.4%后停牌，公司宣布计提265亿美元减值准备
item.description: 斯泰兰蒂斯汽车公司周五股价暴跌14.4%后，其在米兰上市的股票暂停交易。此前该公司宣布，由于缩减电动汽车开发计划，将在2025年下半年计提约222亿欧元（265亿美元）的费用。【原文：Milan-listed shares of Stellantis were halted from trading after falling 14.4% on Friday, after the carmaker booked charges of around 22.2 billion euros ($26.5 billion) in the second half of 2025, as it scales down plans for electric-vehicle development.】

item.title: 德国基民盟考虑对16岁以下青少年实施社交媒体年龄限制
item.description: 德国基民盟高层人士表示，随着全球范围内加强限制的趋势日益明显，该党正考虑限制16岁以下儿童使用社交媒体平台。德国总理候选人弗里德里希·默茨领导的基民盟正考虑实施这一措施。【原文：German Chancellor Friedrich Merz's Christian Democrat Union is considering limiting access to social media platforms for children under the age of 16, senior party members said, as a global movement towards tighter restrictions gathers pace.】

item.title: 独家：消息人士称日本三井集团即将入股卡塔尔液化天然气项目
item.description: 知情人士向路透社透露，日本三井物产即将收购卡塔尔能源公司北气田项目第二阶段的部分股权，此举旨在确保液化天然气（LNG）的稳定供应。【原文：Japan's Mitsui & Co is close to buying a stake in the second phase of QatarEnergy's massive North Field project as it seeks to secure stable liquefied natural gas (LNG) supply, five sources close to the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: 汽车制造商Stellantis在2025年下半年因电动汽车业务收缩计提222亿欧元减值准备
item.description: Stellantis周五表示，由于这家法意合资汽车制造商缩减电动汽车开发计划并启动"战略转型"，去年下半年计提了约222亿欧元（265亿美元）的费用。【原文：Stellantis said on Friday it was booking charges of around 22.2 billion euros ($26.5 billion)in the second half of last year as the Franco-Italian automaker scales down electric-vehicle development plans and launches a "strategic shift".】

item.title: LG能源解决方案将收购Stellantis持有的加拿大合资企业股权
item.description: 韩国LG能源解决方案公司周五宣布，计划以象征性金额100美元收购Stellantis集团在加拿大电池合资企业所持的49%股权。【原文：South Korea's LG Energy Solution said on Friday it plans to buy the 49% stake held by Stellantis in their battery joint venture in Canada for a nominal amount of $100.】

item.title: 早间要闻：裁员潮加剧，美联储面临压力
item.description: 格雷戈尔·斯图尔特·亨特为您解析欧洲及全球市场今日展望。【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Gregor Stuart Hunter.】

item.title: 独家：英特尔、AMD通知中国客户CPU将面临长期等待
item.description: 知情人士透露，英特尔和AMD已通知中国客户，服务器中央处理器（CPU）供应短缺，英特尔警告称交货周期可能长达六个月。【原文：Intel and AMD have notified Chinese customers of supply shortages for server central processing units (CPUs), with Intel warning of delivery lead times of up to six months, people with knowledge of the delays said.】

item.title: 科技股领跌拖累亚洲股市；印尼股市因穆迪下调展望暴跌
item.description: 周五韩国股市延续跌势，投资者持续撤离科技股；与此同时，穆迪下调印尼信用评级展望后，印尼股市下跌逾2%，这对东南亚最大经济体又是一记重击。【原文：South Korean equities extended declines on Friday as investors continue to retreat from tech stocks, while Indonesian shares fell over 2% after Moody's lowered the country's credit rating outlook, the latest blow to Southeast Asia's largest economy.】

item.title: Toyota raises full-year operating profit outlook by 11.8%
item.description: 丰田汽车周五上调全年营业利润预期，因预计日元疲软和成本削减措施将提振业绩。【原文：Toyota Motor raised its full-year operating profit forecast on Friday, as it expects a weak yen and cost reduction efforts to lift its results.】

item.title: 丰田CEO佐藤将卸任，由CFO小池接任
item.description: 全球最大汽车制造商丰田汽车公司周五宣布，首席执行官佐藤孝司将卸任，由该公司首席财务官近藤健太接任。【原文：Toyota Motor Chief Executive Koji Sato will step down, the world's largest automaker said on Friday, and will be replaced by the automaker's chief financial officer, Kenta Kon.】

item.title: 供应链混乱成为航空业"新常态"，需求创历史新高
item.description: 高管和供应商表示，疫情爆发多年后，航空业仍在努力从供应链中断中恢复，而创纪录的乘客需求和地缘政治挑战加剧了这种中断。【原文：Years after the pandemic, the aviation industry is still struggling to recover from supply chain disruptions that have been exacerbated by record passenger demand and geopolitical challenges, executives and suppliers say.】

item.title: Hims & Hers的49美元减肥药震惊众人，唯独其股价未受影响
item.description: Hims & Hers周四宣布推出月费49美元的减肥药，在制药行业掀起波澜。不过该公司股价收盘仍下跌。【原文：Hims & Hers sent a shockwave through the pharmaceutical industry on Thursday with its announcement of a weight-loss pill with a $49-a-month introductory price. Its shares ended down anyway.】

item.title: 力拓澳大利亚投资者对终止嘉能可收购谈判表示欢迎
item.description: 力拓集团的澳大利亚股东们对这家矿业巨头终止与嘉能可合并谈判的决定表示欢迎，并表示现在该公司必须兑现其高度重视的新战略。【原文：Australian shareholders in Rio Tinto have welcomed the mining giant's decision to end merger talks with Glencore , and said it is now up to the company to deliver on a new strategy that it has put so much weight on.】

item.title: 日本最大银行准备增持日本国债，尽管亏损不断扩大
item.description: 日本两大银行表示，尽管现有债券组合的未实现亏损有所增加，但随着利率上升有望带来更高回报，它们准备增加日本政府债券的持有量。【原文：Japan's two largest banks say they are set to increase their holdings of Japanese government bonds as rising interest rates promise higher returns, even though unrealised losses on existing bond portfolios have grown.】

item.title: 日本前货币政策负责人称外汇干预应以加息为支撑
item.description: 日本前任首席货币外交官告诉路透社，动用外汇储备进行货币干预虽能对市场产生即时冲击，但若配合持续加息，其影响将更为持久。【原文：Currency intervention using Japan's foreign exchange reserves can deliver an immediate jolt to markets, but its impact would be more durable if accompanied by steady rate hikes, a former top currency diplomat told Reuters.】

item.title: 比特币逼近6万美元关口，投资者纷纷撤离高风险投资
item.description: 比特币周五跌至16个月低点，并测试关键的6万美元支撑位，因全球科技股抛售加剧，导致各类资产的风险押注全面溃退。【原文：Bitcoin made a 16-month low and tested key $60,000 support on Friday, as a global selloff in technology stocks deepened and washed out risky bets across asset classes.】

item.title: 穆迪下调印尼评级展望后，印尼市场再度抛售
item.description: 印尼股市和货币周五大幅下跌，此前穆迪下调了该国信用评级展望。这是东南亚最大经济体今年动荡开局中的最新冲击，此前该国股市上周遭遇了800亿美元的暴跌。【原文：Indonesian stocks and currency skidded on Friday after Moody's lowered the country's credit rating outlook, the latest jolt in a turbulent start to the year for Southeast Asia's largest economy after an $80 billion rout of its equity market last week.】

item.title: 美元料创11月以来最强劲周表现，日元在选举前趋稳
item.description: 周五美元汇率维持在两周高点附近，有望创下自11月以来最强劲的周度表现。因人工智能支出担忧引发股市暴跌令投资者感到不安，而日元则在周日全国大选前走强。【原文：The U.S. dollar steadied near a two-week high on Friday, poised for its strongest weekly performance since November as a rout in stocks driven by AI-spending concerns rattled investors, while the yen firmed ahead of a national election on Sunday.】

item.title: 特朗普推出药品折扣网站后 日本制药企业股价暴跌
item.description: 美国总统特朗普推出的处方药折扣网站上线后，日本制药公司股价周五在东京早盘交易中大幅下跌。【原文：Shares of Japanese pharmaceutical companies slumped in early Tokyo trading on Friday after U.S. President Donald Trump's website offering discounted prescription medicines went live.】

item.title: 股市暴跌，人工智能领域溃败加剧，白银遭受重创
item.description: 亚洲股市周五早盘延续跌势，连续第二个交易日走低，因华尔街抛售潮加剧，贵金属和加密货币则陷入剧烈震荡。【原文：Asian stocks extended losses into a second day in early trading on Friday as a selloff on Wall Street intensified, with precious metals and cryptocurrencies gripped by wrenching volatility.】

item.title: 油价在美伊会谈前延续跌势
item.description: 美国原油期货周五延续跌势，有望录得数周来首次周线下跌。随着投资者将关注焦点转向当天晚些时候在阿曼举行的美伊核谈判结果，市场对中东地区供应中断的担忧有所缓解。【原文：U.S. crude futures extended their decline on Friday, on track for their first weekly drop in weeks, as concerns about supply disruption in the Middle East eased with investors focusing on the outcome of U.S.-Iran nuclear talks in Oman later in the day.】

item.title: 星巴克成功驳回密苏里州针对其DEI政策的诉讼
item.description: 密苏里州一名联邦法官周四驳回了该州共和党主导政府提起的诉讼。该诉讼指控星巴克利用其对多样性、公平性和包容性的承诺作为幌子，系统性地基于种族、性别和性取向实施歧视。【原文：A federal judge in Missouri on Thursday dismissed a lawsuit by the Republican-led state accusing Starbucks of using its commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion as a pretext to systematically discriminate based on race, gender and sexual orientation.】

item.title: 詹妮弗·加纳创立的Once Upon a Farm公司在美国首次公开募股中筹集近1.98亿美元
item.description: 由演员詹妮弗·加纳联合创立的儿童有机食品公司"童话农场"周四宣布，其在美国首次公开募股中筹集资金近1.98亿美元。【原文：Once Upon a Farm, the children's organic food company co-founded by actor Jennifer Garner, said on Thursday it had raised nearly $198 million in its U.S. initial public offering.】

item.title: SiTime技术有望应用于数十亿颗瑞萨芯片，SiTime首席执行官表示
item.description: SiTime首席执行官周四表示，该公司的技术最终可能应用于日本瑞萨电子数十亿枚芯片中。【原文：SiTime's technology could eventually end up in billions of chips from Japan's Renesas , SiTime's chief executive said on Thursday.】

item.title: 独家报道：xAI出售交易为xAI及SpaceX投资者带来税务、财务及法律层面的多重利好
item.description: 据知情人士透露，埃隆·马斯克在SpaceX收购xAI时采用了常见的两步并购流程，该流程具有双重优势：既避免了偿还数十亿美元债务，又为股东提供了税收优惠。此举同时使SpaceX免于承担xAI的任何法律责任。【原文：Elon Musk used a common two-step merger process in SpaceX's purchase of xAI that had the dual benefit of avoiding the repayment of billions of dollars in debt while giving shareholders a tax advantage, according to people familiar with the transaction. It also protects SpaceX from any legal liability from xAI.】

item.title: 日本麒麟公司以7.75亿美元将Four Roses波本威士忌品牌出售给加洛公司
item.description: 日本麒麟控股公司周五宣布，将以最高7.75亿美元的价格将其肯塔基波本威士忌品牌"四玫瑰"出售给美国E&J加洛酒业公司。【原文：Japanese brewer Kirin Holdings said on Friday it will sell its Kentucky bourbon brand Four Roses to E&J Gallo Winery of the U.S. for up to $775 million.】

item.title: 花旗银行宣布为特朗普账户的政府捐款提供匹配计划
item.description: 花旗集团周四宣布，将为符合条件的员工家庭匹配美国政府对拟议特朗普账户的1000美元初始捐款。【原文：Citigroup will match the U.S. government's initial $1,000 contribution to the proposed Trump Accounts for eligible employees' families, the U.S. lender announced on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国邮政服务公司报告季度亏损12.5亿美元，面临现金短缺困境
item.description: 美国邮政服务公司周四报告季度净亏损12.5亿美元，该公司正面临持续的流动性问题，并再次呼吁进行改革以解决其财务困境。【原文：The U.S. Postal Service on Thursday reported a net quarterly loss of $1.25 billion as it faces ongoing liquidity concerns and renewed calls for reforms to address its financial difficulties】

item.title: 美芯科技季度利润低于预期，内存短缺影响显现
item.description: 芯片制造商微芯科技周四预测第四季度利润低于华尔街预期，引发市场对内存供应短缺将对整个半导体行业造成冲击的担忧。【原文：Chipmaker Microchip Technology forecast fourth-quarter profit below Wall Street estimates on Thursday, raising concerns about the impact of a memory-supply crunch on the wider semiconductor industry.】

item.title: Atlassian上调年度营收预期，因软件支出表现强劲
item.description: Atlassian周四上调了2026财年营收增长预期，押注企业软件服务将获得强劲支出，因客户正日益将人工智能融入业务运营。【原文：Atlassian raised its fiscal 2026 revenue growth forecast on Thursday, betting on strong spending on its enterprise software services as clients increasingly incorporate artificial intelligence into their businesses.】
